description.label: Description
description.value: Sometimes referred to as an alley bow by rogues or ruffians, this small crossbow fires small bolts that are sometimes used to deliver poison to the target. It's small enough to be shot one-handed, but it still requires two hands to load.

description.label: Description
description.value: Shorter than traditional arrows but similar in construction, bolts are the ammunition used by crossbows.

description.label: Description
description.value: A mix of flexible and molded boiled leather, a suit of this type of armor provides some protection with maximum flexibility.

description.label: Description
description.value: The rapier is a long and thin piercing blade with a basket hilt. It is prized among many as a dueling weapon.
When a creature Omblin can see targets him with an attack, Omblin gains a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against the attack.
Omblin deals an extra [[/r 1d6 # precision]] to creatures that have the flat-footed condition.
Omblin ignores the reduction to his Speed from armor and deducts 5 feet from any one penalty to his Speed (such as from a spell).
When Omblin critically hits a target and deals damage, the target is flat-footed against his attacks until the end of his next turn.
